TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> On 3/16/2020 at 8:54 AM, LittleBitMore said:
> 
> 
> What's your perspective on KSP itself?
> 

From not quite three feet away.  Had to switch to a dedicated pair of "computer glasses", what with worn-out middle-aged eyes, and bifocals were becoming tiresome for it.

> 
> 
> On 3/16/2020 at 8:54 AM, LittleBitMore said:
> 
> 
> What do you think about us users?
> 

You're what make the KSP forums my favorite place on the internet.  I've never participated in any other online community to any significant degree, because I find them some combination of uninteresting and/or actively toxic.  This is a neat place because of the people in it.

> 
> 
> On 3/16/2020 at 8:54 AM, LittleBitMore said:
> 
> 
> The forum design and layout?
> 

It gets the job done.  UI's clunky in places, but to be honest I've never seen *<u>any</u>* forum software that made me wanna write poetry about it.

> 
> 
> On 3/16/2020 at 8:54 AM, LittleBitMore said:
> 
> 
> Your fellow mods?
> 

My favorite social circle.

> 
> 
> On 3/16/2020 at 8:54 AM, LittleBitMore said:
> 
> 
> What's your side on \*insert any KSP forum debate (for example, Dres or MechJeb) here\*? What do you think about that debate, as an entirety?
> 

"My, folks sure seem to find some silly stuff to get worked up about"

> 
> 
> On 3/16/2020 at 8:54 AM, LittleBitMore said:
> 
> 
> How many moderators are there?
> 

They're listed, as others have pointed out already.

> 
> 
> On 3/16/2020 at 8:54 AM, LittleBitMore said:
> 
> 
> What are some interesting hobbies you value even higher than KSP and the forums (if any)?
> 

KSP's still my go-to hobby.  Other than that:  reading (a lot!), hiking, drone photography.

> 
> 
> On 3/16/2020 at 8:54 AM, LittleBitMore said:
> 
> 
> Story behind your current profile picture?
> 

Had no profile picture for the first couple years on the forum, nothing really seemed right-- what would a Snark actually *<u>look</u>* like?  Henry Holiday was [decidedly coy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Hunting_of_the_Snark#Illustrations) on the subject.  ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")  Then one day I came across this image and immediately thought "that's it!"

> 
> 
> On 3/16/2020 at 8:54 AM, LittleBitMore said:
> 
> 
> What's your side on \*insert any internet debate (for example, airplane on treadmills or water's wetness) here\*? What do you think about that debate, as an entirety?
> 

An airplane on a treadmill would have no trouble at all taking off, for [obvious reasons](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/102649-so-you-have-a-plane-on-a-conveyor-belt/&do=findComment&comment=3378838).  This is not a hard problem.  (Though a lot of folks who don't understand how physics works tie themselves in knots over stating the problem in an illogical way that presupposes an answer.)

> 
> 
> On 3/16/2020 at 8:54 AM, LittleBitMore said:
> 
> 
> What's an interesting fact about astronomy you think you're one of the only people to know?
> 

Well, obviously if I *<u>told</u>* you, then it would no longer qualify, now would it? ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif ":huh:")

>

Evidently not.
